input.description: One of post, get, put and delete.

The name of the Adapter to use for this Process.
Default - RESTAdapter
The target server URL.
Indicates the desired data type for the Adapter response. Valid values: JSON (default), XML
Specifies whether to establish a secure connection. Valid values: true, false Default value: false
Specifies whether to install certificates. Valid values: true, false Default value: false
Specifies whether to allow unsigned certificates from trusted zones. Valid values: true, false Default value: false
Specifies the Java standard Trust Key Store Pass Phrase. Default value: changeit

Specify Character set name to encode or decode the characters. E.g. Character set Supporting Language Shift_JIS : Japanese character set. Big5 : Traditional Chinese character set. ISO-8859-2 : ISO character set for Central European languages.

Specifies the format in which the public (X.509 certificate) and private keys used for signing the HTTP Request will be provided. The keys can be provided via Java Keystore (JKS) or PEM/DER files or unencrypted Base64-encoded PEM format.
Valid values: keystore, key-files and key-data

Specifies the file containing Private Key used to sign the HTTP Request using the signing algorithm. The formats supported by the adapter are -
1) Base64-encoded PEM (Privacy Enhanced Mail) format 2) DER (Definite Encoding Rules) format
Private key file is required when signature mode is 'key-files'

Specifies the file containing X509 Certificate (Public Key). The formats supported by the adapter are -
1) Base64-encoded unencrypted PEM (Privacy Enhanced Mail) format 2) DER (Definite Encoding Rules) format
Certificate file is required when signature mode is 'key-files'

XML specifying the Private Key in Base64-encoded PEM format.
Example -
<private-key-data>-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY----- MIICdQIBADANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQEFAASCAl8wggJbAgEAAoGBAKomKro6VbW4PeQtUhNzZpSH26vb BTBtH1r4EjnIv4vnhSyyA62ewpROVNn0SpvjoBFwE88HcX3tXym/zbVgtdPke9K+SYHP6CWdiLqn ........ -----END PRIVATE KEY-----</private-key-data>
Private key data is required when signature mode is 'key-data'

XML specifying the X509 Certificate (Public Key) in unencrypted Base64-encoded PEM format.
Example -
<certificate-data>-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- MIICdzCCAeCgAwIBAgIFXseN1xYwDQYJKoZIhvcNAQEFBQAwUzELMAkGA1UEBhMC VVMxEzARBgNVBAoTCkFtYXpvbi5jb20xDDAKBgNVBAsTA0FXUzEhMB8GA1UEAxMY ........ -----END CERTIFICATE-----</certificate-data>
certificate data is required when signature mode is 'key-data'

Specifies the path to the keystore containing the client certificate.
KeyStore file is required when signature mode is 'keystore'

Specifies the password of the keystore file.
KeyStore passphrase is required when signature mode is 'keystore'
Specifies the password of the key stored in key store file.

Specifies the alias name in the keystore that identifies the Public Key Certificate (PKC), the web server uses to authenticate the client.
client alias is required when signature mode is 'keystore'
Specifies if redirects should be enabled. Valid values - true,false Default value - true
Enable downloading of attachment/file.
Specify the directory where downloaded file will be saved.
Specifies the time (in seconds) to wait when establishing a connection. Default value: 10 seconds (if not specified in request and configuration)

This input parameter allow user to ignore or retain new line break marker in adapter response
If true: The new line break character/marker (if exist) is ignored and adapter response returned in single line.
If false: The new line break character/marker (if exist) is preserved in adapter response
Default value = true
Let's suppose the URL returns below response while access through the browser ---- one two three four ----
HTTP adapter response for same URL with value of in parameter set to "ignore line break in response"
If set to true (which is default value) The response returns in message body is
<message-body>onetwothreefour</message-body>
if set to false -
The response returns in message body is
<message-body>one two three four </message-body>
Please Note: This situation mostly occurs when response data content is of type is text/plain
Supported secure protocols - comand separated values like : TLSv1,TLSv2.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <options> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[use ssl]')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,"use-ssl-certificate":"$[use ssl]"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[install cert]')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,"install-certificate":"$[install cert]"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[allow unsigned]')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,"allow-unsigned-certificate":"$[allow unsigned]"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${passphrase}')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,"passphrase":"$[passphrase]"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[return data format]')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,"return-data-format":"$[return data format]"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[charset]')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,"character-set":"$[charset]"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[redirects]')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,"enable-redirects":"$[redirects]"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[download attachment]')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,"download-attachment":"$[download attachment]"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[download dir]')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,"download-directory":"$[download dir]"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[line break]')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,"ignore-line-break-in-response":"$[line break]"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[timeout]')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,"request-timeout":"$[timeout]"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[protocols]')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,"secure-protocols":"$[protocols]"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[sign mode]')>0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">, $[sign props]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </options> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <value> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length(normalize-space(.)) > 0 and boolean(name(/*) = 'EncryptedData')"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">false</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:when test="string-length(normalize-space(.)) > 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">true</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">unknown</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </value> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <value> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">{</xsl:text> $[options] <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length(normalize-space(.)) > 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">, "headers": {</xsl:text> <xsl:value-of select="." disable-output-escaping="no" /> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">}</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise /> </xsl:choose> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">}</xsl:text> </value> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <headers> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="boolean(//*[name() = 'EncryptedData'])"> <xsl:copy-of select="value/*" /> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:value-of select="." disable-output-escaping="no" /> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </headers> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

input.value: Before Removing enclosing braces from headers json...
After Removing enclosing braces from headers json...

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <value> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">{</xsl:text> $[options] <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length(normalize-space(.)) > 0"> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="contains(., '"headers"')"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,</xsl:text> <xsl:value-of select="." disable-output-escaping="no" /> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">,</xsl:text> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">"headers" : {</xsl:text> <xsl:value-of select="." disable-output-escaping="no" /> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">}</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise /> </xsl:choose> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">}</xsl:text> </value> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <headers> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="boolean(//*[name() = 'EncryptedData'])"> <xsl:copy-of select="value/*" /> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:value-of select="." disable-output-escaping="no" /> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </headers> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" xmlns:xalan="http://xml.apache.org/xalan" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:variable name="headersToken">${headers}</xsl:variable> <xsl:variable name="encryptedHeadersXml" select="xalan:nodeset($headersToken)//*[name() = 'EncryptedData']" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <rest-adapter-request> <headers> <xsl:copy-of select="$encryptedHeadersXml" /> </headers> <body> <xsl:copy-of select="//*[name() = 'EncryptedData']" /> </body> </rest-adapter-request> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" xmlns:xalan="http://xml.apache.org/xalan" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <adapter-request> <target-adapter> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">rest-actor</xsl:text> </target-adapter> <peer-location> <location> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">this</xsl:text> </location> </peer-location> <request-action>${request action}</request-action> <request-data> <xsl:copy-of select="." /> </request-data> </adapter-request> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" xmlns:xalan="http://xml.apache.org/xalan" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" cdata-section-elements="headers " /> <xsl:template match="/"> <adapter-request> <target-adapter> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">rest-actor</xsl:text> </target-adapter> <peer-location> <location> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">this</xsl:text> </location> </peer-location> <request-action>${request action}</request-action> <request-data> <rest-adapter-request> <headers> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">$[headers]</xsl:text> </headers> <body> <xsl:copy-of select="//*[name() = 'EncryptedData']" /> </body> </rest-adapter-request> </request-data> </adapter-request> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" xmlns:xalan="http://xml.apache.org/xalan" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:variable name="bodyToken">${body}</xsl:variable> <xsl:variable name="bodyXml" select="xalan:nodeset($bodyToken)" /> <xsl:variable name="headerToken">${headers}</xsl:variable> <xsl:variable name="headersXml" select="xalan:nodeset($headerToken)" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <adapter-request> <target-adapter> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">rest-actor</xsl:text> </target-adapter> <peer-location> <location> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">this</xsl:text> </location> </peer-location> <request-action>${request action}</request-action> <request-data> <xsl:copy-of select="." /> </request-data> </adapter-request> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" xmlns:xalan="http://xml.apache.org/xalan" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" cdata-section-elements="headers body " /> <xsl:template match="/"> <adapter-request> <target-adapter> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">rest-actor</xsl:text> </target-adapter> <peer-location> <location> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">this</xsl:text> </location> </peer-location> <request-action>${request action}</request-action> <request-data> <rest-adapter-request> <headers> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">$[headers]</xsl:text> </headers> <body>$[body]</body> </rest-adapter-request> </request-data> </adapter-request> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Implement logic common to all REST actions - post, get, put and delete.
